page.title: 01THE PERTON AREA
page.content: In and around Perton the land is mostly farmland. There is nothing of major or national interest in this area. A large part of the area is taken up by the Village of Perton. This is a new urban development centered on a man-made lake. This areas area used to be a Second Wolrd War Airfield and after the war it was used as a Racetrack. Away from Perton Village there is the town of Wolverhampton, part of which is in the survey area-Wightwick and Tettenhall. Wightwick is a residential area situated on the edge of the countryside. In Wightwick is Wightwick Manor, a 19th century house now owned by the National Trust.
